direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the buffer's position (read or write) by a specified count, handling similar exceptions and state changes.
Both methods involve writing data to the buffer and updating the write position, sharing similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods involve operations on the buffer, though one writes and the other reads, they share similar parameter handling and state updates.
Both methods involve writing data to the buffer at specified offsets, sharing similar resource access patterns and exception handling.
Both methods handle buffer overflow and underflow exceptions similarly, though they operate on different buffer positions.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require buffer initialization before performing write operations.
Writing data to the buffer is a prerequisite for consuming the write buffer.
The method can be used to verify the state of the buffer after consuming the write buffer.
